files.patch:
@@ -30,2 +30,0 @@
- * @requires vm.compiler2.enabled
- *
@@ -97,0 +95,2 @@
+    // a double precise float point is composed of 3 parts: sign/e(exponent)/f(signicant)
+    // e (exponent) part of a float value
@@ -100,0 +100,1 @@
+    // f (significant) part of a float value
@@ -104,1 +105,1 @@
-    // prepare test data
+    // prepare for data of f (i.e. significand part)
@@ -110,1 +111,0 @@
-    fis[fidx++] = 0;
@@ -114,0 +114,1 @@
+    fis[rand.nextInt(fidx)] = 0;
@@ -115,1 +116,1 @@
-    // run test & verify
+    // generate input arrays for testing, then run tests & verify results
@@ -117,0 +118,4 @@
+      // generate test input by combining different parts:
+      //   previously generated f values,
+      //   random value in e (i.e. exponent) range,
+      //   both positive and negative of previous combined values (e+f)
@@ -121,0 +126,1 @@
+        // combine e and f
@@ -122,0 +128,2 @@
+        // combine sign(+/-) with e and f
+        // positive values
@@ -123,0 +131,1 @@
+        // negative values
@@ -127,1 +136,1 @@
-      // test
+      // run tests

@@ -30,2 +30,0 @@
- * @requires vm.compiler2.enabled
- *
@@ -97,0 +95,2 @@
+    // a single precise float point is composed of 3 parts: sign/e(exponent)/f(signicant)
+    // e (exponent) part of a float value
@@ -101,0 +101,1 @@
+    // f (significant) part of a float value
@@ -105,1 +106,1 @@
-    // prepare test data
+    // prepare for data of f (i.e. significand part)
@@ -111,1 +112,0 @@
-    fis[fidx++] = 0;
@@ -115,0 +115,1 @@
+    fis[rand.nextInt(fidx)] = 0;
@@ -116,1 +117,1 @@
-    // run test & verify
+    // generate input arrays for testing, then run tests & verify results
@@ -118,0 +119,4 @@
+      // generate test input by combining different parts:
+      //   previously generated f values,
+      //   all values in e (i.e. exponent) range,
+      //   both positive and negative of previous combined values (e+f)
@@ -119,0 +124,1 @@
+        // combine e and f
@@ -120,0 +126,2 @@
+        // combine sign(+/-) with e and f
+        // positive values
@@ -121,0 +129,1 @@
+        // negative values
@@ -125,1 +134,1 @@
-      // test
+      // run tests
